message.content:
Step 1: Calculate the Quick Assets (all current assets except inventories). Use the End_amount figures from the balance sheet:
• Cash on Hand = 1,482,632.85  
• Bank Deposits = 1,100,000.00  
• Interest Receivable = 20,559.00  
• Accounts Receivable = 10,221,447.35  

Quick Assets = 1,482,632.85 + 1,100,000.00 + 20,559.00 + 10,221,447.35  
       = 12,824,639.20  

Step 2: Identify the Current Liabilities. In this case, the only current liability is Taxes Payable:
• Total Current Liabilities = 727,140.68  

Step 3: Compute the Quick Ratio:
 Quick Ratio = Quick Assets / Current Liabilities  
      = 12,824,639.20 / 727,140.68  
      ≈ 17.63  

Step 4: For the Net Profit Margin, use figures from the income statement:
• Net Profit = 405,999.64  
• Total Revenue = 14,542,813.42  

Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%  
      = (405,999.64 / 14,542,813.42) × 100%  
      ≈ 0.02791 × 100%  
      ≈ 2.79%

The final solution in JSON format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Quick Ratio": "17.63",
    "Net Profit Margin": "2.79%"
  }
}
